title: Share Your Discord Profile Link Across Any Platform

steps.title: Make sure Developer Mode is enabled.
steps.content: Make sure Developer Mode is enabled. You can enable it by clicking the Gear/Settings icon in Discord . Then go to Advanced > Developer Mode in the mobile or desktop app. Make sure the toggle switch next to "Developer Mode" is turned on. The Gear/Settings icon is in the lower-left corner next to your username on the desktop application. On mobile, tap your profile icon in the lower-right corner and then tap the Gear icon in the upper-right corner. This method can come in handy if you want to link to your Discord profile on a website, message board, social media profile, or even in your email signature. However, it's not the easiest way to share your Discord profile, which is to share your username instead. You can use this method on any device, including on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.

steps.title: Copy your User ID.
steps.content: Copy your User ID. Your User ID is a string of numbers that identifies you on Discord. To find your User ID, use the following steps: Desktop: Click your profile picture and click Copy User ID . Mobile: Locate a message you've sent in a server or DM and tap your profile picture. Tap ••• in the upper-right corner, and then tap Copy User ID to copy your user ID to your clipboard.

steps.title: Paste the link to share your Discord profile.
steps.content: Paste the link to share your Discord profile. Your Discord profile link follows this format: https://discordapp.com/users/USERID . All you'll need to do is replace USERID with the user ID you copied to your clipboard. For example, https://discordapp.com/users/my_unique_user_ID . If that link doesn't work, try https://discord.com/users/USERID where your User ID replaces "USERID." Anyone can visit this site using the browser on their smartphone, tablet, or computer.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. You may need to swipe right to open the left side panel. Your profile picture is in the bottom right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap the Settings icon .
steps.content: Tap the Settings icon . This gear icon is in the top right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Account.
steps.content: Tap Account . It's usually the second option on the menu under "Account Settings."

steps.title: Tap Username.
steps.content: Tap Username . This will open the text field so you can change your username, but you'll just copy it.

steps.title: Tap and hold the current username text and select Copy.
steps.content: Tap and hold the current username text and select Copy . When you tap and hold your username, a contextual menu with editing and selecting options will appear next to your finger.

steps.title: Share the copied username with others.
steps.content: Share the copied username with others. You can share it in Messenger or in a text message by tapping and holding the blank text space where you'd normally enter your text and select Paste when the contextual menu appears. They can use your username to add you as a friend on Discord.

steps.title: Click your profile picture.
steps.content: Click your profile picture. It's at the bottom of your screen toward the left.

steps.title: Click the copy icon next to your display name.
steps.content: Click the copy icon next to your display name. It looks like duplicate pieces of paper and only appears when you hover your mouse over your display name. Your display name is what others see and might be different than your username, which is copied when you select the copy icon next to your display name. For example, a username can be JaneDoe2846 but the display name is Jane Doe.

steps.title: Share the copied username with others.
steps.content: Share the copied username with others. You can share it in Messenger or in a text message by tapping and holding the blank text space where you'd normally enter your text and select Paste when the contextual menu appears. They can use your username to add you as a friend on Discord. [1] X Research source

steps.title: What is the difference between a display name and a username?
steps.content: What is the difference between a display name and a username? Your username is a unique name that is used to identify your Discord account. Your display name or nickname is a public name you choose that is shown throughout Discord. Your display name does not have to be unique.

steps.title: What is the difference between a username and a userID?
steps.content: What is the difference between a username and a userID? Your username is a name you pick for your Discord account. You can select almost anything as your username as long as it is unique. Your userID is a unique 18-digit number that is used to identify your account. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Can you change your userID on Discord?
steps.content: Can you change your userID on Discord? No, your userID is set when you set up your Discord account. It is permanent and cannot be changed.

steps.title: Can you change your username or display name?
steps.content: Can you change your username or display name? Yes, you can change your display name and username. Your username has to be unique and not used by any other user. Your display name does not have to be unique. It can be whatever you want.

steps.title: What is a server name?
steps.content: What is a server name? A server name is a name you are given for a particular server. This name will only appear when you are in that server. Your display name and username will be used everywhere else in Discord. [3] X Research source
